<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/19/governments-turn-private-sector-generate-needed-ventilators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Place Needs More Ventilation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Visualization of lungs as oxygen tanks " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcvdmVudGlsYXRvci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because of the coronavirus pandemic, healthcare systems all over the world are facing a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/19/business/coronavirus-ventilators-manufacture-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">severe shortage</a> of ventilators.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ventilators are machines that help people get oxygen into their lungs. Because COVID-19 can cause lung inflammation, or pneumonia, ventilators are essential tools for treating patients who are severely ill.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. especially is sorely understocked. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Wednesday his state will need 37,000 ventilator-attached ICU hospital beds. It has 3,000. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So governments are turning to the private sector  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued a request Monday for manufacturers to help churn out ventilator parts. More than 60 companies have responded, including Airbus and Vauxhall (a car company owned by French auto group PSA). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stateside, President Trump invoked the Defense Production Act, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/03/18/818069722/trump-invokes-a-cold-war-relic-the-defense-production-act-for-coronavirus-shorta?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a Cold War-era law</a> that allows the government to direct private industry to generate critical materials in times when "national defense" is threatened.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM said that CEO Mary Barra met with President Trump and discussed producing ventilators. Normal GM production in North America is on pause until at least March 30. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A CNBC source said GM wouldn’t be adjusting its equipment, but devoting extra factory space to making ventilators.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And Elon Musk did what Elon Musk does </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fired up Twitter. Wednesday night, the Tesla and SpaceX CEO tweeted that he’d conscript those companies to make ventilators if needed. NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio promptly swan-dived into Musk’s mentions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/278/de_blasio_tweet.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 458px;" alt="Bill de Blasio tweet"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>@NYCMayor</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But with broad business shutdowns sweeping the globe, it’s not clear where Tesla or SpaceX would house ventilator production. Yesterday, Tesla said it was temporarily suspending production at its New York and California plants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Ventilators are expensive, which makes hospitals reluctant to buy them in bulk if demand will taper off before long. That's only compounding the extreme shortage, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/03/18/ventilator-shortage-hospital-icu-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the WaPo</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/19/microsoft-slack-report-surge-users?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Are You Team Slack or Team Teams?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a matter of weeks, video conferencing app Zoom became a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/call-zoomers-gen-z-flocks-zoom-quarantine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">household name</a>. But there’s a couple of other workplace communication companies that want you to remember they’re still here. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Microsoft Teams <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/19/microsoft-teams-jets-to-32m-daus-announces-new-features-as-remote-work-booms/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> a whopping 44 million daily active users—more than double November’s 20 million and up 12 million from last week. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Microsoft is hoping upcoming video conferencing features like noise suppression, a “raise hand” tool, and the ability to break into side convos will distract users from Monday’s outage, </span><span><span>when European users logged on en masse.</span></span><span> </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since launching in 2016, Teams has competed bitterly with Slack (finally passing it in users last summer). Yesterday, Slack <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/3/18/21184865/slack-redesign-update-sidebar-changes-available-now-download?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> its biggest redesign ever, providing easier customization and navigation.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Coronavirus is a double-sided coin. </strong></span><span>Slack's paying customers </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/332bf86e-9eae-46fa-8d95-98be180ce37a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are up 7,000</a></span><span> since the start of February—40% more than typical quarterly growth. But the company could shed 5,000 customers in the next sixth months as companies start to fold.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead..</strong>an analyst with research firm IDC told the FT the pandemic may have accelerated the communications and collaboration market by seven years.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/19/uber-lyft-demand-plummets-markets-hit-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No, I Will Not Share My Car With You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Uber app shutting down" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/283/uber_app.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Uber app shutting down" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/283/uber_app.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s harder out there for a ride-share company than catching fireflies in November. In the week ending Monday, U.S. riders spent <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-spending-on-ride-hailing-with-uber-lyft-falls-as-coronavirus-spreads-11584525600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">21% less on Uber</a> and 19% less on Lyft. Markets with severe coronavirus outbreaks are facing even sharper declines.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bookings for both services were down 27% in California in the same timeframe. For scale, California accounts for 9% of Uber bookings.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In hard-hit cities like Seattle, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/03/19/uber-coronavirus-analyst-call/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trips are down</a></span><span> as much as 70%. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One silver lining?</strong> Customers are <em>staying</em> in, but also <em>ordering</em> in. Uber Eats has gotten a bump in traffic, though CEO Dara Khosrowshahi admitted most of Uber’s ride-hailing customers use other food delivery services (awkward), so they’re trying to convert riders to its delivery service. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another silver lining: </strong>$10 billion in cash to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-uber/uber-shares-soar-after-ceo-says-has-enough-cash-to-ride-out-coronavirus-crisis-idUSKBN2162MN?feedType=RSS&feedName=businessNews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">weather</a> big drops in demand. Shares rose almost 40% yesterday as Khosrowshahi showed off his wallet and held off adjusting Q2 guidance for now.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>this could dent profitability targets for Lyft (end of 2021) and Uber (end of 2020). An RBC analyst told the WSJ Uber’s 2020 revenue could fall up to 37% and profits as much as 79%.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IMAGES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/19/coronavirus-images-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may feel lonely, but you are not alone. Billions of people across the globe had their lives upended this week by the coronavirus pandemic. Here are some pictures that tell the story.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">New York, NY </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sure why not. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/272/frozen_margs.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Takeout sign on restuarant "></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman/status/1240427559290130442?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><small> <em>Neal Freyman</em> </small></a></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">Perth, Australia</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Long lines in Costco despite no samples. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><em> <img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/273/costco_line.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="line in Costco "></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Paul Kane/Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">Pisa, Italy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><em> <img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/274/pisa_cleaner.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Cleaning the plaza of the Leaning Tower of Pisa "></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Laura Lezza/Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">Caracas, Venezuela</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Experts are worried that a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/latino/venezuela-faces-covid-19-outbreak-hospitals-times-lack-soap-water-n1163331?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">news media blackout</a> and a feeble healthcare system could hamstring Venezuela's response.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><em> <img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/275/venezuela_banana_market.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="A woman selling bananas "></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Leonardo Fernandez Viloria/Getty Images</em> </small></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0;line-height: 22px;">San Francisco, California </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The city and neighboring counties are under <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/everything-out-our-control-san-francisco-eases-lockdown-n1163376?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shelter-in-place</a> restrictions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><em> <img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/276/sf_movie_theater.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="SF movie theater with a hopeful message "></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em> </small></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Instagram vs. Reality: How Social Media Handles a Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Sarah Frier on Business Casual" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzkvc2FyYWhfZnJpZXJfb25fYnVzaW5lc3NfY2FzdWFsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We hold these WFH truths to be self-evident: that we’ll always wear pajama pants and that we’re spending way more time than usual scrolling through social media. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram have become lifelines for human contact and important headlines in the era of #socialdistancing, putting pressure on Big Tech to clamp down on misinformation and potentially harmful viral cure-alls. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But can Zuck & Co. handle it? Are they stepping up to the plate to root out dangerous misinformation? Can we trust <em>anything</em> we see on social media anymore?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In this special episode of Morning Brew’s </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> podcast</strong>, Bloomberg social media reporter Sarah Frier explains how tech c-suites are navigating what, for many, has become one of the most uncertain periods of their existence...and how those business decisions impact society.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen here:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/sarahfrier_apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/sarahfrier_spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/sarahfrier_all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All week we've been collecting your funniest WFH stories. Here's a choice selection:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"Left NYC to go home to my parents' house—I was presenting to 100+ people and my dad walked through at 9:30am yelling, 'Is it too early for a drink?'"</span></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"My copywriter discovered virtual backgrounds on Zoom for the first time and spent the entire meeting virtually touring all around the world without realizing all of us were crazily distracted by his 'trip.'"</span></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"I was looking out my apartment window the other day and saw someone had set a desk up on the roof of his apartment building with multiple monitors and everything."</span></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>“I had a goal to learn to play the guitar. On a particularly boring conference call, I pulled out the guitar and started strumming away. Of course, I thought I was muted but I wasn't. As I paused to figure out my next finger placement, I heard my boss say, ‘Whoever is playing the guitar, will you please stop?’”</span></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Anything crazy/horrific happen to you while working from home? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/paI0M3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share it here</a>. </p>

sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTHCARE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/19/governments-turn-private-sector-generate-needed-ventilators?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThis Place Needs More Ventilation\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Visualization of lungs as oxygen tanks \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzcvdmVudGlsYXRvci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause of the coronavirus pandemic, healthcare systems all over the world are facing a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/19/business/coronavirus-ventilators-manufacture-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esevere shortage\u003c/a\u003e of ventilators.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVentilators are machines that help people get oxygen into their lungs. Because COVID-19 can cause lung inflammation, or pneumonia, ventilators are essential tools for treating patients who are severely ill.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. especially is sorely understocked. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Wednesday his state will need 37,000 ventilator-attached ICU hospital beds. It has 3,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo governments are turning to the private sector  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued a request Monday for manufacturers to help churn out ventilator parts. More than 60 companies have responded, including Airbus and Vauxhall (a car company owned by French auto group PSA). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStateside, President Trump invoked the Defense Production Act, \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/03/18/818069722/trump-invokes-a-cold-war-relic-the-defense-production-act-for-coronavirus-shorta?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea Cold War-era law\u003c/a\u003e that allows the government to direct private industry to generate critical materials in times when \"national defense\" is threatened.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM said that CEO Mary Barra met with President Trump and discussed producing ventilators. Normal GM production in North America is on pause until at least March 30. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA CNBC source said GM wouldn’t be adjusting its equipment, but devoting extra factory space to making ventilators.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd Elon Musk did what Elon Musk does \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFired up Twitter. Wednesday night, the Tesla and SpaceX CEO tweeted that he’d conscript those companies to make ventilators if needed. NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio promptly swan-dived into Musk’s mentions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/278/de_blasio_tweet.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 458px;\" alt=\"Bill de Blasio tweet\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003e@NYCMayor\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut with broad business shutdowns sweeping the globe, it’s not clear where Tesla or SpaceX would house ventilator production. Yesterday, Tesla said it was temporarily suspending production at its New York and California plants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Ventilators are expensive, which makes hospitals reluctant to buy them in bulk if demand will taper off before long. That's only compounding the extreme shortage, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/03/18/ventilator-shortage-hospital-icu-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Teams?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a matter of weeks, video conferencing app Zoom became a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/17/call-zoomers-gen-z-flocks-zoom-quarantine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehousehold name\u003c/a\u003e. But there’s a couple of other workplace communication companies that want you to remember they’re still here. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Microsoft Teams \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/19/microsoft-teams-jets-to-32m-daus-announces-new-features-as-remote-work-booms/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e a whopping 44 million daily active users—more than double November’s 20 million and up 12 million from last week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMicrosoft is hoping upcoming video conferencing features like noise suppression, a “raise hand” tool, and the ability to break into side convos will distract users from Monday’s outage, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewhen European users logged on en masse.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince launching in 2016, Teams has competed bitterly with Slack (finally passing it in users last summer). Yesterday, Slack \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/3/18/21184865/slack-redesign-update-sidebar-changes-available-now-download?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e its biggest redesign ever, providing easier customization and navigation.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoronavirus is a double-sided coin. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSlack's paying customers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/332bf86e-9eae-46fa-8d95-98be180ce37a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare up 7,000\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the start of February—40% more than typical quarterly growth. But the company could shed 5,000 customers in the next sixth months as companies start to fold.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead..\u003c/strong\u003ean analyst with research firm IDC told the FT the pandemic may have accelerated the communications and collaboration market by seven years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s harder out there for a ride-share company than catching fireflies in November. In the week ending Monday, U.S. riders spent \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-spending-on-ride-hailing-with-uber-lyft-falls-as-coronavirus-spreads-11584525600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e21% less on Uber\u003c/a\u003e and 19% less on Lyft. Markets with severe coronavirus outbreaks are facing even sharper declines.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBookings for both services were down 27% in California in the same timeframe. For scale, California accounts for 9% of Uber bookings.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn hard-hit cities like Seattle, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/03/19/uber-coronavirus-analyst-call/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrips are down\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as much as 70%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne silver lining?\u003c/strong\u003e Customers are \u003cem\u003estaying\u003c/em\u003e in, but also \u003cem\u003eordering\u003c/em\u003e in. Uber Eats has gotten a bump in traffic, though CEO Dara Khosrowshahi admitted most of Uber’s ride-hailing customers use other food delivery services (awkward), so they’re trying to convert riders to its delivery service. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother silver lining: \u003c/strong\u003e$10 billion in cash to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-uber/uber-shares-soar-after-ceo-says-has-enough-cash-to-ride-out-coronavirus-crisis-idUSKBN2162MN?feedType=RSS\u0026feedName=businessNews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eweather\u003c/a\u003e big drops in demand. Shares rose almost 40% yesterday as Khosrowshahi showed off his wallet and held off adjusting Q2 guidance for now.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethis could dent profitability targets for Lyft (end of 2021) and Uber (end of 2020). An RBC analyst told the WSJ Uber’s 2020 revenue could fall up to 37% and profits as much as 79%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
